data.title: Deadline
data.meta_description: Deadline.com is always the first to break up-to-the-minute entertainment, Hollywood and media news, with an unfiltered, no-holds-barred analysis of events.
data.text:
Latest News

K-Pop Celebrity Sports Show ‘Idol Star Athletics Championships’ Returns To MBC After Two Years

Korean broadcaster MBC has revived its popular K-pop celebrity gameshow Idol Star Athletics Championships (ISAC), which will return in the fall after a two-year hiatus. Filming will take place in August and the upcoming season will premiere during Korea’s Chuseok holiday season in…

International

The Gotham Group Signs ‘The Damned’ & ‘The Valhalla Murders’ Director Thordur Palsson

EXCLUSIVE: The Gotham Group has signed Icelandic film director Thordur Palsson whose feature debut, the horror film The Damned, premiered at this year's Tribeca Festival and will be released domestically by Vertical this fall. Palsson was the creator and lead director of The Valhalla Murders, which…

Exclusive

International

Kennedy Center Honors To Go To Francis Ford Coppola, Grateful Dead, Bonnie Raitt, Arturo Sandoval And The Apollo

This year’s Kennedy Center Honors will be awarded to director Francis Ford Coppola, rock band Grateful Dead, blues and rock singer-songwriter Bonnie Raitt, jazz trumpeter, pianist and composer Arturo Sandoval and the venue The Apollo. The ceremony will take place on Dec. 8, for broadcast on Dec. 23…

Awards

BTS’s Jimin To Showcase New Song ‘Who’ On Jimmy Fallon’s ‘The Tonight Show’

BTS star Jimin will perform ‘Who,’ the main track from his second solo album, on NBC’s The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. According to his label, Big Hit Music, Jimin’s performance was pre-recorded and is scheduled to air at 11:35 p.m. on Monday night’s show. Jimin is currently…

‘Flatliners Resurrection’ Poised To Test Genre IP Frenzy With J.D. Barker Novel

EXCLUSIVE: Before you watch the Oz Perkins-directed crafty serial killer thriller Longlegs that won last weekend, you have to first go through a dizzying parade of derivative horror film trailers. Genre is hot again, especially titles with proven concepts. Author J.D. Barker is using that opportunity…

Exclusive

Leeds International Film Festival Sets Dates, Spotlights On Stuart Croft & Smita Patil

EXCLUSIVE: Here’s the plan for the 2024 Leeds International Film Festival (LIFF). The 38th edition of the fest will run from November 1-17 at venues across the UK city, with screenings held at the Everyman Leeds, Vue Leeds in the Light, Hyde Park Picture House and Howard Assembly Room. A full…

Exclusive

International

‘Michael’: Kino Films To Distribute Michael Jackson Biopic In Japan

Tokyo-based Kino Films has struck a deal with Lionsgate and GK Films to distribute Michael Jackson biopic, Michael, in Japan. Lionsgate is releasing domestically, with Universal set to handle international markets, save Japan where Kino Films expects to release in 2025. The North American release is…

British Anchor Emily Maitlis Told She “Needs Her Head Examined” & Is “Sad Case Of A Human Being” By Trump Ally Being Sued Over Claims Of Election Interference

Top British journalist Emily Maitlis has been told she “needs her head examined” by a Donald Trump ally who refused to back down on her repeated claims of election interference. Maitlis was in the U.S. for her News Agent podcast when she sat down with former news anchor and Arizona state senate…

Viaplay Turnaround Focused On Core Ops; Flight MH-17 Doc Deal; Anna Torv Cast In ‘Territory’; Locarno Juries — Global Briefs

Viaplay Results: Focus On Core Ops Working Slowly Viaplay's focus on doing what it does best willed out in its latest quarterly results, with total turnover down slightly but turnover in core operations increasing by a similar margin. Since the exit of former CEO Anders Jensen amidst financial…

‘The Boys’ Season 4 Finale: Amazon Changes Title & Adds Trigger Warning After Trump Shooting

The Boys Season 4 finale has dropped — and it comes with a health warning after the attempt on Donald Trump’s life over the weekend. As the episode dropped at midnight on July 18, Amazon Prime Video released a statement making clear that any similarities between the storyline and events in…

Breaking Baz: Gary Oldman On How ‘Slow Horses’ Picked Up Speed To Score Its Emmy Nominations

EXCLUSIVE: Gary Oldman says that that the nine Emmy nominations, including for Outstanding Drama Series, received by the wry spy drama Slow Horses "puts an added boost and a spotlight on the show." Slow Horses first trotted onto Apple TV+ in April 2022, gathering audiences as it cantered into second…

Ruth Wilson To Narrate New Audiobooks For Philip Pullman’s ‘His Dark Materials’

EXCLUSIVE: After starring in the BBC and HBO TV adaptation, Ruth Wilson is set to narrate new audiobook editions of Philip Pullman’s classic novels His Dark Materials. Produced and published by Penguin Audio, the third installment in the trilogy (made up of Northern Lights, The Subtle Knife and The Am…
